thread.section_title: Jose Mourinho fuming with Manchester United officials over delayed travel plans after Chelsea defeat – Metro
thread.title: Jose Mourinho fuming with Manchester United officials over delayed travel plans after Chelsea defeat
thread.title_full: Jose Mourinho fuming with Manchester United officials over delayed travel plans after Chelsea defeat

author: Chris Davie
title: Jose Mourinho fuming with Manchester United officials over delayed travel plans after Chelsea defeat
text:
Jose Mourinho was left angry with club officials after his side’s delayed journey home. (Getty Images) Jose Mourinho vented his anger towards Manchester United’s officials after the team were forced to take a five-hour coach trip home following the defeat to Chelsea on Monday evening.
The Daily Mail reports that as he boarded the coach at Stamford Bridge following the 1-0 loss, the United manager was informed that the team’s flight from Heathrow to Manchester was delayed.
United’s journey home by coach was then held up by roadworks, meaning that they did not return to the club’s training ground until 4am on Tuesday morning.
The report claims that United held a training session at 1pm on Tuesday afternoon as they prepare for their Europa League return leg against FC Rostov this Thursday.
Mourinho clashed with Antonio Conte at Stamford Bridge. (AMA/Getty Images) Mourinho and his team took a five-hour coach journey home. (AFP/Getty Images) More: Football Spotted: Chelsea star celebrates Leicester's win over Sevilla in the stands 
Revealed: What Antonio Conte screamed at Jose Mourinho on the touchline 
N'Golo Kante called 'Judas' after Chelsea star watches Leicester City win 
The drastic change in travel plans has come after Mourinho’s repeated criticism of United’s fixture schedule this season.
After their FA Cup exit, United have just two full days of rest before facing Rostov, while a trip to Middlesbrough follows three days after their Europa League tie.
